issue.title: truyenqqgo.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads)
[NSFW] [https://truyenqqgo.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftruyenqqgo.com)
### Comment
> These are online gambling sites, which are not suitable for children. They should not be advertised or made accessible
> 
> https://vivu88.com/
> https://net88.tv/
> https://hit.club/
> https://lp.sun.win/
> 
> When my child accessed https://truyenqqgo.com, they saw advertisements for these sites and clicked on them

### [NSFW] Screenshots
  [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/1eewxg708pq8wg0sgcgkg040ow8o08c9vpmk5ii1lc.png?nc=1)
  [Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/ow3pmkx81j44844o8gwwck0c88c88cge8rgxgm0mu0.png?nc=1)

  [Screenshot 5](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/hwtgh1hpg6go40wokk8wg08s4cc4gk0nrebf1jj200.png?nc=1)

Information | Value

AdGuard product: | AdGuard DNS
DNS setup: | Device or router settings
DNS server: | AdGuard DNS Family Protection server
System version: | MacOS
Browser: | Safari

comment.body:
> @stephenhawk8054 uBlock Origin Annoyances could redirect `||cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/disable-devtool` to a dummy script too. It already has filters for specific sites that connect to this annoying script.

Do you know which sites need redirections?

issue.title: search.brave.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://search.brave.com/search?q=miguel+company&source=android](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fsearch.brave.com%2Fsearch%3Fq%3Dmiguel%2Bcompany%26source%3Dandroid) ### Comment > Using Brave browser and Brave search engine while AdGuard is enabled, the search results are being cleared from the browser (it can be seen for a short time), when AdGuard is disable, the result remains in the screen. This issue was introduced with last update Username: `@vldesco` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/922fi44rjn0ow8w8cs0coo4osgw4ks4fl07zmkjxi8.jpg?nc=1)

issue.title: security-report.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [http://security-report.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fsecurity-report.com) ### Comment > ## READ THIS SUPER CAREFULLY > > Hi. > > Some websites can HACK into LAN using JS. > > More information here: > https://github.com/uBlockOrigin/uBlock-issues/issues/1070#issue-62499511 > > http://ghacks.net/2020/05/25/ebay-is-port-scanning-your-system-when-you-load-the-webpage > > Here is more info about exploits: > https://www.oligo.security/blog/0-0-0-0-day-exploiting-localhost-apis-from-the-browser > > So can you please integrate filter like this into your base filter list: > https://ublockorigin.github.io/uAssetsCDN/filters/lan-block.txt > > Or somehow hardcode this into apps/extensions? ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/rjpmu41dcq8o04s8wwkw8s404888wcwn9fd48acp5c.jpg?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser Extension v4.4.49 MV2 Browser: | - Tracking protection: | disabled Filters: | Ad blocking:
